name: insensibility
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of being unconscious: She lay in a state of insensibility until ten o'clock, when she took her last breath. He was beaten into insensibility and then dropped in the canal.
the fact of not caring about something or being unwilling or unable to react to it: insensibility to The anaesthetic injection will cause unconsciousness as well as insensibility to pain. Both parents had an insensibility to the welfare of their offspring. See
insensible
More examplesFewer examplesThe patient fell into a state of insensibility.She lay on the floor, drugged into insensibility. He was furious with her for her insensibility which bordered on cruelty.
